p: Serological and nucleic acid-based evidence suggests that dromedary camels from Africa and Asia have harboured MERS-CoV for more than 35 years. 6, 7, 8 The high diversity of MERS-CoV in African camels and the existence of a conspecific virus in African bats point to its geographical roots in Africa. 8, 9, 10 However, the geographical structure (in terms of phylogeography) of African MERS-CoV remains understudied.
